intro: Launaea cabrae subsp. cabrae, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its gray-green, hairy leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant is adapted to hot, dry environments and has a deep root system to access groundwater. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in disturbed or marginal habitats. Launaea cabrae subsp. cabrae plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for livestock in its native range.
